revised_title: Sir David Prain's Life and Contributions to Science
tldr: The article is an obituary for Sir David Prain, a prominent botanist and natural historian. Born in 1857, Prain was a key figure in the field of botany and made significant contributions to the study of plant life. He began his career in education, studying at the University of Aberdeen, before transitioning to medical studies and eventually focusing on botany. Prain held various positions in academia and was a close friend of fellow botanist J.W.H. Trail. His work in botany and natural history is celebrated and remembered in this obituary.
